Compatibility.comm: Easy to use with Windows XP.

cont.entity_a: Easy to use with no issues on Dell Inspiron 600m.
cont.entity_b: Fast transfer speed and compatible with Vista.
Light and slender for easy travel, well made.

cont.entity_a: Durable despite physical damage, still works like new after three years.
cont.entity_b: Constructed sturdily enough for carrying in a laptop bag.

cont.entity_a: Nice looking and easily detected, but lacks a short USB cable and better indicator light.
cont.entity_b: Light and sleek design with a glowing orange light.

cont.entity_a: Storage capacity matches desktop computer, quick and efficient to use.
cont.entity_b: Too small for newer PC backups.

cont.entity_a: Speed is not an issue, transferring 50GB of files takes about an hour.
cont.entity_b: Fast transfer speed. Copied 60 GB in 1.5 hours.

cont.entity_a: Does not require external power, works great with provided PS/2 cable.
cont.entity_b: Loose connection on the hard drive side, requiring manual holding for power.

cont.entity_a: Some inexpensive drives are unreliable, especially on IBM laptops and iMac (2007).
cont.entity_b: Seagate FreeAgent GO 120 GB drive is unreliable, requires two USB ports.

cont.entity_a: The entire SmartDisk USB line has issues with Mac laptops.
cont.entity_b: Failed to detect on several devices. Failed after extended storage, resulting in data loss.
Plug and play functionality with easy setup.
Seagate provides a 5-year warranty, and the drive works flawlessly.
Third-party backup software works perfectly after issues with bundled software.

cont.entity_a: SmartDisk customer support informed it doesn't work with any Powerbook G4.
Fast and easy return policy with online processing.
